meanings.sent1: Tommy is such a gomer for forgetting his lunch at home.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a gomer and listen to your parents' advice.
meanings.sent3: The gomer in the movie always makes everyone laugh with his silly antics.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a gomer when she tripped over her own feet in front of everyone.
meanings.sent5: Being a gomer in class can sometimes lead to funny situations.

meanings.definition: A person who is disliked or annoying.
meanings.sent1: The new student turned out to be a real gomer with his constant complaining.
meanings.sent2: I try to avoid being a gomer by being kind to everyone around me.
meanings.sent3: The gomer at work always manages to ruin the mood with his negative comments.
meanings.sent4: Her little brother can be a real gomer when he doesn't get his way.
meanings.sent5: Being a gomer is not a good way to make friends.

meanings.definition: To mess up or make a mistake.
meanings.sent1: I always seem to gomer things up when I'm in a rush.
meanings.sent2: Try not to gomer the recipe by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent3: He managed to gomer his presentation by forgetting the key points.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was gomering everything up during the important meeting.
meanings.sent5: It's easy to gomer when you're not paying attention.
